trans-unit.source: How to use the SendGrid email service (Java) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use the SendGrid email service (Java) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how send email with the SendGrid email service on Azure. Code samples written in Java.
trans-unit.target: Learn how send email with the SendGrid email service on Azure. Code samples written in Java.

trans-unit.source: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the SendGrid email service on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the SendGrid email service on Azure.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in Java.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in Java.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include constructing email, sending email, adding attachments, using filters, and updating properties.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include constructing email, sending email, adding attachments, using filters, and updating properties.

trans-unit.source: For more information on SendGrid and sending email, see the <linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on SendGrid and sending email, see the <linkText>Next steps</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid is a [cloud-based email service] that provides reliable [transactional email delivery], scalability, and real-time analytics along with flexible APIs that make custom integration easy.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid is a [cloud-based email service] that provides reliable [transactional email delivery], scalability, and real-time analytics along with flexible APIs that make custom integration easy.

trans-unit.source: Common SendGrid usage scenarios include:
trans-unit.target: Common SendGrid usage scenarios include:

trans-unit.source: Automatically sending receipts to customers
trans-unit.target: Automatically sending receipts to customers

trans-unit.source: Administering distribution lists for sending customers monthly e-fliers and special offers
trans-unit.target: Administering distribution lists for sending customers monthly e-fliers and special offers

trans-unit.source: Collecting real-time metrics for things like blocked e-mail, and customer responsiveness
trans-unit.target: Collecting real-time metrics for things like blocked e-mail, and customer responsiveness

trans-unit.source: Generating reports to help identify trends
trans-unit.target: Generating reports to help identify trends

trans-unit.source: Forwarding customer inquiries
trans-unit.target: Forwarding customer inquiries

trans-unit.source: Email notifications from your application
trans-unit.target: Email notifications from your application

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <http://sendgrid.com>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <http://sendgrid.com>.

trans-unit.source: Obtain the javax.mail libraries, for example from <http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javamail> and import them into your code. At a high-level, the process for using the javax.mail library to send email using SMTP is to do the following:
trans-unit.target: Obtain the javax.mail libraries, for example from <http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javamail> and import them into your code. At a high-level, the process for using the javax.mail library to send email using SMTP is to do the following:

trans-unit.source: Specify the SMTP values, including the SMTP server, which for SendGrid is smtp.sendgrid.net.
trans-unit.target: Specify the SMTP values, including the SMTP server, which for SendGrid is smtp.sendgrid.net.

trans-unit.source: Extend the javax.mail.Authenticator class, and in your implementation of the getPasswordAuthentication method, return your SendGrid user name and password.
trans-unit.target: Extend the javax.mail.Authenticator class, and in your implementation of the getPasswordAuthentication method, return your SendGrid user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Create an authenticated email session through a javax.mail.Session object.
trans-unit.target: Create an authenticated email session through a javax.mail.Session object.

trans-unit.source: Create your message and assign To, From, Subject and content values.
trans-unit.target: Create your message and assign To, From, Subject and content values.

trans-unit.source: This is shown in the <linkText>How To: Create an Email</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: This is shown in the <linkText>How To: Create an Email</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: Send the message through a javax.mail.Transport object.
trans-unit.target: Send the message through a javax.mail.Transport object.

trans-unit.source: This is shown in the <linkText>How To: Send an Email[how to: send an email]</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: This is shown in the <linkText>How To: Send an Email[how to: send an email]</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: The following shows how to specify values for an email.
trans-unit.target: The following shows how to specify values for an email.

trans-unit.source: The following shows how to send an email.
trans-unit.target: The following shows how to send an email.

trans-unit.source: The following code shows you how to add an attachment.
trans-unit.target: The following code shows you how to add an attachment.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid provides additional email functionality through the use of filters.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid provides additional email functionality through the use of filters.

trans-unit.source: These are settings that can be added to an email message to enable specific functionality such as enabling click tracking, Google analytics, subscription tracking, and so on.
trans-unit.target: These are settings that can be added to an email message to enable specific functionality such as enabling click tracking, Google analytics, subscription tracking, and so on.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of filters, see <linkText>Filter Settings</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of filters, see <linkText>Filter Settings</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following shows how to insert a footer filter that results in HTML text appearing at the bottom of the email being sent.
trans-unit.target: The following shows how to insert a footer filter that results in HTML text appearing at the bottom of the email being sent.

trans-unit.source: Another example of a filter is click tracking.
trans-unit.target: Another example of a filter is click tracking.

trans-unit.source: Let’s say that your email text contains a hyperlink, such as the following, and you want to track the click rate:
trans-unit.target: Let’s say that your email text contains a hyperlink, such as the following, and you want to track the click rate:

trans-unit.target: To enable the click tracking, use the following code:

trans-unit.source: Some email properties can be overwritten using set*Property* or appended using add*Property*.
trans-unit.target: Some email properties can be overwritten using set*Property* or appended using add*Property*.

trans-unit.source: For example, to specify ReplyTo addresses, use the following:

trans-unit.source: SendGrid offers web-based APIs that you can use to leverage additional SendGrid functionality from your Azure application.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid offers web-based APIs that you can use to leverage additional SendGrid functionality from your Azure application.

trans-unit.source: For full details, see the <linkText>SendGrid API documentation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For full details, see the <linkText>SendGrid API documentation</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Now that you’ve learned the basics of the SendGrid Email service, follow these links to learn more.
trans-unit.target: Now that you’ve learned the basics of the SendGrid Email service, follow these links to learn more.

trans-unit.target: Sample that demonstrates using SendGrid in an Azure deployment: <linkText>How to send email using SendGrid from Java in an Azure deployment</linkText><title></title>
